engineering_design_principles.description: Understanding properties and behaviors of substances
engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Analyzing the unique properties and characteristics of reactants, such as molecular geometry and chemical composition, to determine their behavior and interaction with other substances.
Using variables and coefficients in a chemical equation to represent reactants and indicate stoichiometric relationships between them.
Creating experiments to optimize reaction conditions and improve reaction efficiency, and analyzing the resulting data to refine the process.
Gaining a deep understanding of the geometric and mathematical principles that govern chemical reactions.
